intro: Hazardia orcuttii, commonly known as the desert evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Hazardia orcuttii plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
